trans-unit.source: Represents a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> column that hosts <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> controls in its cells.
Use DataGridComboBoxColumn to display data where there is a set of items to choose from, such as an enumeration.
DataGridComboBoxColumn allows users to select an item from a drop-down list.
The following illustration shows a DataGridComboBoxColumn.

![A DataGridComboBoxColumn](~/add/media/ndp-datagridcombobox.png "A DataGridComboBoxColumn") To populate the drop-down list, first set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.ItemsSource%2A> property for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by using one of the following options: - A static resource.
For more information, see [StaticResource Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
- An x:Static code entity.
For more information, see [x:Static Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
- An inline collection of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBoxItem> types.

Once the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.ItemsSource%2A> is set, bind the selected item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> to the data item for the row that the cell is in.

You can set the binding by using one of the following properties: |Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.TextBinding%2A>|Sets the binding path of the text for the currently selected item.| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedItemBinding%2A>|Sets the binding path of the object that is currently selected.| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValueBinding%2A>|Sets the binding path to the value of the selected item specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValuePath%2A> property.| When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true`, users cannot edit the column and they will not be able to see the drop-down list.

If you want to display other types of data, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> provides the following column types: |Column Type|Data Display| |-----------------|------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridHyperlinkColumn>|Use to display URI data.| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn>|Use to display Boolean data.| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridTextColumn>|Use to display text.| If you want to use other controls in your <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid>, you can create your own column types by using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridTemplateColumn>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn"></xref> class.
Causes the column cell being edited to revert to the specified value.
The element that the column displays for a cell in editing mode.
The previous, unedited value in the cell being edited.
Gets or sets the binding object to use when getting or setting cell content for the clipboard.
An object that represents the binding.
Performs any required validation before exiting the editing mode.
The element that the column displays for a cell in editing mode.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if validation fails; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets the default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.EditingElementStyle*> property.
This style is the same as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.DefaultElementStyle%2A>.

If you are creating new styles for cells and you want to inherit some of the existing style elements, base the new style on DefaultEditingElementStyle by using the <xref:System.Windows.Style.BasedOn%2A> property.
The default value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.EditingElementStyle*>.
Gets the default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.ElementStyle*>.
If you are creating new styles and you want to inherit some of the existing style elements, base the new style on DefaultElementStyle by using the <xref:System.Windows.Style.BasedOn%2A> property.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.ElementStyle*>.
Gets or sets a path to a value on the source object to provide the visual representation of the object.
Use this property to define a simple template that describes how to display the data objects.

Setting the DisplayMemberPath property is equivalent to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.Path%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property binding in a template.
The following template shows an example of the equivalent setting.

[!code-xml[DataGrid_ComboBoxColumnSample2#1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/comboboxcolumnsample2/window1.xaml#1)] [!code-xml[DataGrid_ComboBoxColumnSample2#1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/p-system.windows.control_41_1.xaml)]
The path to a value on the source object.
The registered default is an empty string ("").
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.DisplayMemberPath*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the element that the column displays for a cell in editing mode.
You can reset the default EditingElementStyle by getting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.DefaultEditingElementStyle%2A>.
The style that is used when rendering an editing element.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.EditingElementStyle*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the element that the column displays for a cell that is not in editing mode.
You can reset the default ElementStyle by getting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.DefaultElementStyle%2A>.
The style that is used when rendering a display-only element.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.ElementStyle*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets a combo box control that is bound to the column's <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedItemBinding*>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValueBinding*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.TextBinding*> values.
The cell that will contain the generated element.
The data item represented by the row that contains the intended cell.

A new combo box control that is bound to the column's <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedItemBinding*>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValueBinding*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.TextBinding*> values.

Gets a read-only combo box control that is bound to the column's <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedItemBinding*>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValueBinding*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.TextBinding*> values.
The cell that will contain the generated element.
The data item represented by the row that contains the intended cell.

A new, read-only combo box control that is bound to the column's <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedItemBinding*>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValueBinding*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.TextBinding*> values.
Gets or sets a collection that is used to generate the content of the combo box control.
This property populates the drop-down list for all the combo boxes in the column.
This is equivalent to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property on <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>.
A collection that is used to generate the content of the combo box control.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.ItemsSource*> dependency property.
To be added.

Determines the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn.IsReadOnly*> property based on property rules from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> that contains this column.
The value that was passed to the delegate.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the combo boxes in the column cannot be edited; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedItemBinding*> property changes.
The previous binding.
The binding that the column has been changed to.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValueBinding*> property changes.
The previous binding.
The binding that the column has been changed to.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.TextBinding*> property changes.
The previous binding.
The binding that the column has been changed to.
Called when a cell in the column enters editing mode.
The element that the column displays for a cell in editing mode.
Information about the user gesture that is causing a cell to enter editing mode.
The unedited value.
Refreshes the contents of a cell in the column in response to a binding change.
The cell to update.
The name of the column property that has changed.
Gets or sets the binding for the currently selected item.
Setting the SelectedItemBinding property is equivalent to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem%2A> property of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
The binding for the selected item.
Gets or sets the value of the selected item, obtained by using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValuePath*>.
The selected value is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValuePath%2A> property of the selected item.
The selected value path is a property on the selected item object.
Setting this property is equivalent to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue%2A> property of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
The binding for the selected value.
Gets or sets the path that is used to get the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue*> from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem*>.
The SelectedValuePath property allows you to display a value of the selected item object by setting the path to that property.
This is equivalent to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValuePath%2A> property on <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector>.
The path to get the selected value.
The registered default is an empty string ("").
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridComboBoxColumn.SelectedValuePath*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the binding for the text in the text box portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> control.
Setting the TextBinding property is equivalent to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> control.
The binding for the text of the currently selected item.
Gets the resource key for the style to apply to a read-only combo box.
The key for the style.
